titleStmt.title: Dixon Browning et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
To his Excellency
The Governor of the Commonwealth of Ky.

The undersigned citizens of the county of Hopkins states that Jno W Poe was indicted in the Hopkins Circuit Court for a breach of the peace, committed in said county. They say that by the verdict of the Jury and Judgment of a Court, he was fined Thirty One Dollars. They say that said Poe is a poor man, with a family to support, that the difficulty took place in the woods where he was at work some distance from any public road or residence of any citizen and that there were only three persons present at the time of the difficulty. That said Poe has served his county in the Army of the United States and it would greatly oppress & harrass said deft to be compelled to pay said fine. They believe it is a case which calls for executive clemency. Wherefore they ask your Excellency to remit said fine except costs.

Names
Dixon Browning
William Todd
D Peyton
J L Faver
Joel L Houston
J T Lawton
Sam Morton

Tho E Bramlette
